text: Jeannie Berlin (born Jeannie Brette May, November 1, 1949) is an American actress and screenwriter. She was born in Los Angeles. She is known for her role in the 1972 movie The Heartbreak Kid, for which she received Academy Award and Golden Globe nominations. Her mother is actress, comedian and director Elaine May. She later played the leading role in Sheila Levine Is Dead and Living in New York (1975). She also starred in Margaret (2011), Inherent Vice (2014) and Cafe Society (2016). ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1949 births Category:Living people Category:American movie actors Category:American stage actors Category:American television actors category:American voice actors Category:Actors from Los Angeles Category:Screenwriters from Los Angeles Category:20th-century American actors Category:21st-century American actors Category:Jewish American actors
title: Jeannie Berlin
